section.title: What are Action methods?
section.p: Agavi Actions can be executed in different modes. Every such mode has a corresponding executeXXX method, where "xxx" matches the mode name. This allows the developer to create Actions that implement complicated user interface: widgets, multi-page wizards, Actions that can both display and handle forms and so on.

A default Agavi application is configured so that Action methods are mapped to HTTP verbs. So, HTTP GET becomes "read", HTTP POST "write" and so on. To change this map (for example, to map HTTP POST to 'create' or allow handling of additional methods), see the global configuration for class AgaviWebRequest.
The routing map also allows you to specify the mode for the action. When you execute Actions in containers, you can request a specific executeXXX Action method as well.
